definition: to show appreciation (by kind words, small gifts etc)/to comfort
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)

sentences.english: I have served you for many years , but you are never willing to comfort me even once .
sentences.chinese: 多年來我辛苦侍奉你，你卻一點也不慰勞我。

sentences.english: She also said she would go to Carrefour to get some good food for them.
sentences.chinese: 還說要去家樂福給他們買好喫的慰勞一下。

sentences.english: Hezekiah spoke encouragingly to all the Levites, who showed good understanding of the service of the Lord .
sentences.chinese: 希西家慰勞一切善於事奉耶和華的利未人。

sentences.english: We join in the paychecks of the day, eat a big meal treat yourself a little.
sentences.chinese: 在發薪水的日子我們聚在一起，喫一頓大餐慰勞自己。
我們帶着禮物慰勞士兵。

sentences.english: The children would fill their shoes with straw and food for St Nicholas's for the reindeer that carried the gifts.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們會在鞋中放上草料和食物來慰勞駝禮物的馴鹿。

sentences.english: The local people butchered pigs and sheep to express their gratitude to the Eighth Route Army soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 當地老百姓殺豬宰羊慰勞八路軍戰士。

definition: to express sympathy, greetings, consolation etc
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
to be on duty (of a security guard etc)
to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
to return from a rewarding journey
to patrol/to make a tour/to inspect/to scan with one's eyes
to pay the bill (in a restaurant etc) (loanword from Cantonese)/(fig.) to bear responsibility
